meanings.definition: A substance that acts like a hormone and is produced by cells in the body
meanings.sent1: Autacoids help the body like hormones do.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study autacoids to understand how cells work.
meanings.sent3: The autacoids in our body are like tiny helpers keeping things in balance.
meanings.sent4: In a way, autacoids are the body's own little messengers, delivering important signals.
meanings.sent5: Imagine autacoids as tiny messengers running around the body, delivering important messages to cells.

meanings.definition: A chemical mediator that acts locally in the body
meanings.sent1: When there's an injury, autacoids rush to the scene to help.
meanings.sent2: Autacoids work right where they are needed in the body.
meanings.sent3: It's like autacoids are the local heroes of our body, always ready to assist.
meanings.sent4: Autacoids act like little messengers, delivering urgent messages within the body.
meanings.sent5: Picture autacoids as tiny firefighters, quickly responding to emergencies in the body.

meanings.definition: A signaling molecule that regulates physiological functions
meanings.sent1: Autacoids play a key role in controlling how our body functions.
meanings.sent2: The autacoids in our body help keep everything running smoothly.
meanings.sent3: It's as if autacoids are the conductors orchestrating the body's symphony.
meanings.sent4: Autacoids are like traffic controllers, ensuring all processes in the body move efficiently.
meanings.sent5: Think of autacoids as the directors of a complex play, guiding each actor (cell) to perform their part perfectly.
